oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DAMAGE VARIATIONS ON LOW-CRESTED BREAKWATERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Garcia, Rolando
Kobayashi, Nobuhisa
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: low-crested breakwater
rubble mound
damage
trunk
head
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The cross-shore numerical model CSHORE extended to oblique waves is used to predict the spatial variation of damage on different sections of the trunk and head of a low-crested breakwater. The agreement is mostly within a factor of 2 but the model overpredicts damage on the back head of a submerged structure. An experiment was conducted in a wave flume for a low-crested stone structure located inside the surf zone on a sand beach. The model is shown to reproduce the measured cross-shore wave transformation on the beach without and with the structure as well as the measured small damage on the structure.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; structures.14
